description: TEHRAN- Secretary General of the Economic Cooperation Organization Dr. Asad M. Khan held a productive meeting today with H.E. Dr. Farzaneh Sadegh Malvajerd, Minister of Roads and Urban Development of the Islamic Republic of Iran to discuss enhanced cooperation in the region in the transport sector.
title: ECO Secretary General Meets with Iranian Minister of Roads and Urban Development

description: TEHRAN - Jhon Duran struck twice and Cristiano Ronaldo once as Al Nassr Club defeated Esteghlal 3-0 in the second leg of their AFC Champions League Elite 2024/25 Round of 16 tie at the King Saud University Stadium on Monday.
title: Al Nassr ease past Esteghlal in 2024/25 ACL Elite

description: TEHRAN-Iranian director Mohammadreza Nourmandipour’s “The Mold” will go on scree at the 28th edition of Brussels Short Film Festival (BSFF), which will be held in the Belgian capital from April 23 to May 3, Mehr reported.
title: Brussels film festival to screen Iranian short “The Mold”

description: TEHRAN-The Persian translation of the book “Watching Over Her” written by French author Jean-Baptiste Andrea has been released in the Iranian book market.
title: Jean-Baptiste Andrea’s 2023 Prix Goncourt winner available in Persian

description: TEHRAN- Medea Theater Hall in Tehran will be playing host to a reading performance of American playwright Tennessee Williams’ memory play “The Glass Menagerie”.
title: Tehran theater to host reading performance of Tennessee Williams’ “The Glass Menagerie”

description: TEHRAN- The virtual book sales section of the 32nd edition of the International Holy Quran Exhibition featuring 221 publishers and 14,282 titles comprising a total of 1,831,542 volumes, is accessible on the official website of the event.
title: International Holy Quran Exhibition launches virtual book sales

description: TEHRAN-The renowned Iranian-Armenian musician and conductor Loris Tjeknavorian will conduct a concert and an opera based on Ferdowsi's Shahnameh in Armenia later this month.
title: Tjeknavorian to perform “Rostam and Sohrab” opera in Armenia

description: BEIRUT — At a malicious political timing that matches the anti-resistance conspiracy to prevent the reconstruction of what has been left behind by the US-led Israeli aggression, the World Bank issued a report titled “Rapid Damage and Needs Assessment in Lebanon”.
title: World Bank complicating reconstruction process in Lebanon

description: TEHRAN – The Zionist regime that has always faced security threats in its borders is seeking to exploit the domestic crises faced by neighboring nations, particularly Syria, to bolster its strategic situation and enhance its strategic projects.
title: Sykes-Picot Agreement II: From social engineering to separatist projects in West Asia

description: LONDON - Syria is witnessing a dangerous escalation of armed violence by the new government and its militant factions, most of which come from outside the country, particularly in the coastal regions that were, until recently, considered among the most stable areas in the nation.
title: Syria between terrorism and collusion: The Alawite genocide under Arab silence

description: The German government said on Monday that Israel's decision to halt aid deliveries and cut off the electricity supply to Gaza could prompt a fresh humanitarian crisis in the Palestinian territory.
title: Germany says Israeli aid freeze, electricity cut in Gaza violates ‘international law’

description: TEHRAN – The UN Human Rights chief has condemned the Syrian government for escalating massacres against civilians.
title: “Entire Families” killed in Syria

description: TEHRAN - Trump’s victory in the 2024 U.S. presidential election on November 5th represents a clash between two opposing groups.
title: Trump and return of institutional versus anti-institutional mentality

description: TEHRAN – Iran has summoned Sweden’s ambassador to Tehran in response to the “provocative and baseless” statements made by Sweden’s Minister of Education, Johan Pehrson, regarding the Islamic Republic.
title: Iran summons Swedish ambassador over ‘provocative’ remarks by minister

description: TEHRAN – Tehran has dismissed accusations of interference in Syria, calling them "Baseless and unfounded."
title: Tehran not involved in Syria’s affairs, violence must stop: foreign ministry spokesperson

description: TEHRAN – Hezbollah Secretary-General Sheikh Naim Qassem has renewed calls to reinstate suspended flights between Iran and Lebanon, describing the move as vital for strengthening bilateral ties.
title: Hezbollah leader demands restart of Iran flights, warns against US-Israeli 'military gambles'

description: TEHRAN – When Donald Trump and his newly emboldened vice president, J.D. Vance, stood in the White House and delivered their condescending remarks as those broadcasted across the globe, many saw Trump attempting to cast himself as a figure of moral authority, perhaps in the mold of Martin Luther King Jr. or Mother Teresa, where he spoke as if he were a man deeply concerned with global peace, even going so far as to blame Volodymyr Zelenskyy for the tragic deaths of innocent people in Ukraine’s war with Vladimir Putin.
title: Trump’s American Dream for world: becoming Dr. Jekyll or Mr. Hyde?

description: Any negotiations to resolve the conflict in Ukraine will be doomed to failure if Britain's intervention is not excluded, says Sergey Mironov, head of the A Just Russia - For Truth faction in the Duma.
title: UK as nasty old woman should be kept away from Ukraine war negotiations

description: TEHRAN-In a commentary, Sobh-e-No addressed Trump’s purpose in sending a letter to Iran’s Leader for negotiations.
title: Negotiation or dictating demands?

description: TEHRAN- The Iranian Navy, alongside naval forces from Russia and China, has commenced the seventh iteration of the "Combined Maritime Security Belt" exercise in the northern Indian Ocean. The exercise, designed to bolster maritime security and foster closer naval cooperation, involves twelve countries, including nine observer nations.
title: Iran, Russia, China begin annual joint exercise in Indian Ocean

description: TEHRAN - Arg-e Rayen stands as one of Iran’s most magnificent historical landmarks and is famed as the “second-largest adobe citadel in the world” after the UNESCO-designated Arg-e Bam.
title: Arg-e Rayen: ‘world’s second-largest adobe citadel’

description: TEHRAN - The CEO of the Dafineh museum group has announced the repurposing of a historic building into a new museum, stating that the Iranian Pottery Museum (“Mouzeh Sofalineha-ye Iran”) will soon be inaugurated in Laleh Street, downtown Tehran.
title: Museum of Persian pottery to open soon in Tehran

description: TEHRAN - A new phase of archaeological excavations has commenced on the ruins of Valerian’s Palace in the ancient city of Bishapur, located in Kazerun county of Fars province. The palace is believed to have once served as a residence for the captured Roman Emperor Valerian during the Sassanid era.
title: Excavation work starts on ruins of Valerian’s Palace in Bishapur

description: TEHRAN – Hundreds of Alawite civilians have been executed in cold blood by Syrian security forces along the western coast.
title: Over 400 civilians killed near Syria’s coast

description: TEHRAN – Trade between Russia and Iran is expected to see a significant boost in the coming years, fueled by a shift to national currency settlements and the implementation of the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership Treaty, according to Aleksey Dedov, Russian Ambassador to Iran.
title: Russia, Iran poised for trade surge, cultural expansion following strategic partnership treaty

description: LONDON – U.S. President Donald Trump has resumed discussions about the possibility of negotiating with Iran, claiming that he has sent a message to the Leader of the Islamic Revolution, Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei.
title: Trump wants to reopen talks with Iran, but is the West ready to change its approach?

description: TEHRAN – Judiciary Chief, Gholamhossein Mohseni-Ejei, has donated 500 million rials (about 555 dollars) to help release prisoners of unintentional crimes.
title: Officials contribute to releasing prisoners of involuntary crimes

description: TEHRAN –A total of 136 earthquakes were recorded across the country from March 1 to 7, according to the seismological networks of the Institute of Geophysics of the University of Tehran.
title: Over 135 earthquakes shake Iran in a week

description: TEHRAN – The Ethics Committee of the Football Federation of Iran found Shahrdari Astara team guilty of match-fixing.
title: Iranian football club Shahrdari Astara were relegated for match-fixing

description: TEHRAN – The first artificial intelligence (AI) innovation, metaverse, and blockchain acceleration center, named Hamta, was launched in Tehran on Monday.
title: First sports AI innovation center inaugurated

description: TEHRAN – Brigadier General Hossein Zolfaqari, the Secretary General of Iranian Drug Control Headquarters (DCHQ), is participating in the 68th session of the United Nations Commission on Narcotic Drugs (CND), which is being held from March 10 to 14 in Vienna, Austria.
title: Iran attending 68th session of UN Commission on Narcotic Drugs
Russian scientists are studying chemical composition of plants to create new medicines

description: TEHRAN – In a blatant violation of international humanitarian law, Israel has cut humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip.
title: Starvation is weaponized again in Gaza

description: TEHRAN- The value of non-oil export from Fars province rose 12 percent in the first ten months of the current Iranian calendar year (March 20, 2024-January 19, 2025), as compared to the same period of time in the past year, a provincial official announced.
title: Non-oil export from Fars province up 12% in 10 months on year

description: TEHRAN - President Masoud Pezeshkian says improper energy consumption is among the primary challenges facing the country, while at the same time apologizing for the inconveniences caused by energy imbalances and recent power outages.
title: Pezeshkian warns of improper energy use, apologizes for power outages

description: TEHRAN - Iran’s monthly PMI has experienced a third decline in a row which happened despite expectations for an uptick in demand ahead of the country’s New Year holidays.
title: Iran’s monthly PMI drops again despite hopes for demand recovery

description: TEHRAN - Iran’s Parliament (Majlis) has held its first session to review proposed amendments to the Chamber of Commerce Law, according to a senior Member of Parliament.
title: Majlis holds 1st session on reforming Chamber of Commerce Law

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s South Pars Gas Complex has localized the production of 11,589 equipment items, the company’s managing director announced on Sunday.
title: South Pars gas complex indigenizes over 11,000 equipment items

description: TEHRAN – The first Tehran-Van international train departed from the Iranian capital on Sunday, resuming service after a five-year suspension, the Islamic Republic of Iran Railways (RAI) announced.
title: Tehran-Van train resumes service after 5-year halt

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s Bank Maskan (Housing Bank) has facilitated installment sales for 91,000 units under the National Housing Movement, using its financial resources, out of a total of 378,000 contracted units, the bank’s CEO said.
title: Bank Maskan delivers 91,000 national housing units, awaits $2b capital boost
TehranTimes' journalist in interview with Chinese TV

description: TEHRAN - Sedigheh Khadem, the vice president of Iran’s Kabaddi Federation, says that Iran participated in the Asian Championships with a young team, but they could have won the title.
title: Bright future ahead of young women kabaddi team: official

description: TEHRAN – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has resolutely rejected U.S. attempts to impose negotiations under its “maximum pressure” campaign, describing American demands as coercive diktats incompatible with sovereign diplomacy.
title: Iran's Araghchi dismisses US demands as 'coercive diktats,' affirms peaceful nuclear program

description: TEHRAN - Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi firmly dismisses the possibility of negotiations under pressure and intimidation, noting that talks differ from “bullying”.
title: “Negotiation is different from bullying,” Iran tells Trump

description: BEIJING- The third session of the 14th National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC), China's top political advisory body, held its closing meeting on Monday morning.
title: CPPCC holds closing meeting of annual session

description: By citing fentanyl as the reason, the US government announced in late February that it would hit goods from China with a new 10 percent tariff from March 4.
title: Tariffing China won’t solve US’ fentanyl problem

description: BEIJING- China’s top political advisory body held the closing meeting of its annual session in the capital Beijing on Monday.
title: China's unity shines: CPPCC wraps up annual session in Beijing
